intro: Anchietea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved anchietea, is a flowering plant native to the Cape region of South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems, and the flowers are usually violet or blue in color. Anchietea parvifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
